channel.title: The Renewable Minute
channel.description: News from the growing edge of the renewable energy revolution and commentary on the shenanigans of the oil and gas industry.
channel.itunes:subtitle: the renewable energy radio show
channel.itunes:summary: News from the growing edge of the renewable energy revolution and commentary on the shenanigans of the oil and gas industry.
channel.itunes:keywords: renewable energy, solar power, wind power, hydropower, hydrogen, electric car, geothermal, biofuel, electricity, oil, petroleum, fossil fuel, environment, global warming, zero emissions
channel.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

image.title: The Renewable Minute
image.description: News from the growing edge of the renewable energy revolution and reports on the war between big oil and clean energy technology.

item.title: Going Net-Zero in Santa Fe
item.description: Santa Fe is emerging as the national leader in green building standards, in large part with the help of Santa Fe homebuilder Faren Dancer.
item.itunes:subtitle: Going Net-Zero in Santa Fe
item.itunes:summary: Santa Fe is emerging as the national leader in green building standards, in large part with the help of Santa Fe homebuilder Faren Dancer.
item.itunes:keywords: carbon-neutral, energy efficiency, geothermal, green building, net-zero, solar, The 2030 Challenge, wind power, zero-emmissions
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Can Green Algae Help Save the World?
item.description: Several US companies are harvesting an algae that can be converted to oil and refined into biodiesel. Amazingly, the algae can grow in waste water, where it feeds on carbon dioxide.
item.itunes:subtitle: Can Green Algae Help Save the World?
item.itunes:summary: Several US companies are harvesting an algae that can be converted to oil and refined into biodiesel. Amazingly, the algae can grow in waste water, where it feeds on carbon dioxide.
item.itunes:keywords: environment, global warming, greenhouse, renewable energy, solar power, solar energy, alternative energy, algae, biofuels, ethanol, petrochemical
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: The Arizona Desert Goes Green
item.description: In early 2009, a Spanish solar power company broke ground outside the little town of Gila Bend, southwest of Phoenix, to build what will be the world's largest solar power plant.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arizona Desert Goes Green
item.itunes:summary: In early 2009, a Spanish solar power company broke ground outside the little town of Gila Bend, southwest of Phoenix, to build what will be the world's largest solar power plant.
item.itunes:keywords: environment, global warming, greenhouse, renewable energy, solar power, solar energy, alternative energy
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Making Waves in California
item.description: California's largest utility company PG&E has committed to the development of an ocean wave power plant off the shores of Humboldt County.
item.itunes:subtitle: Making Waves in California
item.itunes:summary: California's largest utility company PG&E has committed to the development of an ocean wave power plant off the shores of Humboldt County.
item.itunes:keywords: environment, global warming, greenhouse, renewable energy, hydroelectric, California, green
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Driving on Air
item.description: India's largest automaker has just unveiled a zero-emission air-powered car, affectionately called the CityCAT. This impressive car is powered entirely from compressed air, and can reach speeds of 68 mph.
item.itunes:subtitle: Driving on Air
item.itunes:summary: India's largest automaker has just unveiled a zero-emission air-powered car, affectionately called the CityCAT. This impressive car is powered entirely from compressed air, and can reach speeds of 68 mph.
item.itunes:keywords: renewable, energy, environment, green tech, air car, alternative fuel cars, auto industry, autos, cars, electric car, zero emissions
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Exxon Stops Drilling
item.description: After posting the largest corporate profit in the recorded history of mankind, Exxon has decided to halt drilling and development of existing oil leases - despite Sarah Palin's campaign to the contrary.
item.itunes:subtitle: Exxon Stops Drilling
item.itunes:summary: After posting the largest corporate profit in the recorded history of mankind, Exxon has decided to halt drilling and development of existing oil leases - despite Sarah Palin's campaign to the contrary.
item.itunes:keywords: Al Gore, autos, Big Oil, excess profits, ExxonMobil, fossil fuels, gas prices, Obama, offshore oil drilling, oil and gas industry, oil prices
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: General Motors Kills 2 Electric Cars
item.description: The car company that sued California rather than produce a zero-emission vehicle now find itself in the cross-hairs of President Obama and just 60 days from bankruptcy.
item.itunes:subtitle: General Motors Kills 2 Electric Cars
item.itunes:summary: The car company that sued California rather than produce a zero-emission vehicle now find itself in the cross-hairs of President Obama and just 60 days from bankruptcy.
item.itunes:keywords: GM, Chevy Volt, electric car, hybrid, Obama, bailout, zero emission vehicle, greenhouse gas, oil and gas, environment, renewable energy
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Out of the Red and Into the Green
item.description: What the world needs now is an energy tech revolution that will not only green our grids but grow our shriveled manufacturing base, which means new jobs.
item.itunes:subtitle: Out of the Red and Into the Green
item.itunes:summary: What the world needs now is an energy tech revolution that will not only green our grids but grow our shriveled manufacturing base, which means new jobs.
item.itunes:keywords: bailout, energy policy, energy tech revolution, Obama, renewable energy tax credit, stimulus bill, Thomas Friedman, energy, energy policy, environment, global warming, Obama, economic stimulus
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Clean Coal Stays in Obama's Stimulus Package
item.description: Despite an environmentally-friendly administration, clean coal got 3.4 billion dollars in the US 2009 stimulus bill.
item.itunes:subtitle: Clean Coal Stays in Obama's Stimulus Package
item.itunes:summary: Despite an environmentally-friendly administration, clean coal got 3.4 billion dollars in the US 2009 stimulus bill.
item.itunes:keywords: clean coal, renewable energy, carbon emissions, Al Gore, energy, energy policy, environment, global warming, Obama, economic stimulus
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Oil Prices Down, Gas Prices Up
item.description: Guess Exxon-Mobile doesn’t want a world recession to interfere with windfall profits for 2009.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oil Prices Down, Gas Prices Up
item.itunes:summary: Guess Exxon-Mobile doesn’t want a world recession to interfere with windfall profits for 2009.
item.itunes:keywords: oil and gas, oil prices, gas prices, Exxon, renewable energy, global warming, emissions
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Chinese Electrics Beat the U.S.
item.description: With Chevrolet’s decision to power their hybrid electric car with batteries made in China, the globe’s greatest polluter may also become the world leader in zero-emission cars.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chinese Electrics Beat the U.S.
item.itunes:summary: With Chevrolet’s decision to power their hybrid electric car with batteries made in China, the globe’s greatest polluter may also become the world leader in zero-emission cars.
item.itunes:keywords: electric cars, hybrid cars, EV1, Chevrolet, Chevy Volt, GM, China, renewable energy, global warming, zero emissions
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: What's Really Behind That Changing Price of Gasoline?
item.description: The same investment bank that got billions in bailout money also used commodity trader techniques from Enron to hyper-inflate the price of oil last summer when supply was high and demand was actually diminishing.
item.itunes:subtitle: What's Really Behind That Changing Price of Gasoline?
item.itunes:summary: The same investment bank that got billions in bailout money also used commodity trader techniques from Enron to hyper-inflate the price of oil last summer when supply was high and demand was actually diminishing.
item.itunes:keywords: auto industry, autos, bailout, Morgan Stanley, Big Oil, energy stock markets, Enron, gas prices, oil and gas industry, oil prices, oil speculation,
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Clean Coal: The New Weapon of Mass Delusion?
item.description: You heard McCain talk about it, you heard Obama support it in the presidential campaign as well. Let’s be clear. There is no tested technology existing today to produce "clean coal".
item.itunes:subtitle: Clean Coal: The New Weapon of Mass Delusion?
item.itunes:summary: You heard McCain talk about it, you heard Obama support it in the presidential campaign as well. Let’s be clear. There is no tested technology existing today to produce "clean coal".
item.itunes:keywords: clean coal, renewable energy, carbon emissions, Al Gore, energy, energy policy, environment, global warming
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Petrol Cheaper Than Ethanol?
item.description: The corn-sourced distilled ethanol that is mixed with gasoline is now more expensive than plain old gasoline. Gasoline blenders have always used more ethanol than required because it was cheaper than gasoline. Not any more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Petrol Cheaper Than Ethanol?
item.itunes:summary: The corn-sourced distilled ethanol that is mixed with gasoline is now more expensive than plain old gasoline. Gasoline blenders have always used more ethanol than required because it was cheaper than gasoline. Not any more.
item.itunes:keywords: gas prices, oil prices, oil and gas, ethanol, hybrid, Big 3 automakers, Detroit, environment, global warming, bailout, meltdown, electric cars, hybrid cars, EV1, Chevy Volt
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Are you driving 75% less? If not, then why is gasoline so cheap?
item.description: Unless the world is using 75% less petroleum, it appears that the sky rocket in prices this summer was driven purely by speculation in the energy stock markets. If that’s so, what is the real cost of oil?
item.itunes:subtitle: Are you driving 75% less? If not, then why is gasoline so cheap?
item.itunes:summary: Unless the world is using 75% less petroleum, it appears that the sky rocket in prices this summer was driven purely by speculation in the energy stock markets. If that’s so, what is the real cost of oil?
item.itunes:keywords: Who Killed the Electric Car, oil speculation, Big 3 automakers, GM, bailout, Detroit, environment, global warming, bailout, meltdown, electric cars, hybrid cars, EV1, Chevy Volt
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Should US Tax Payers Bailout the Electric Car Killer?
item.description: While the US Treasury and Congress debate whether to save the Big 3 carmakers, some wonder whether GM, the Detroit auto giant that killed their electric car 10 years ago, should be given a second chance.
item.itunes:subtitle: Should US Tax Payers Bailout the Electric Car Killer?
item.itunes:summary: While the US Treasury and Congress debate whether to save the Big 3 carmakers, some wonder whether GM, the Detroit auto giant that killed their electric car 10 years ago, should be given a second chance.
item.itunes:keywords: Who Killed the Electric Car, environment, global warming, bailout, meltdown, electric cars, hybrid cars, EV1, Chevy Volt
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: The Company That Killed the Electric Car Brings It Back
item.description: General Motors, after having re-introduced the electric car as the E-V1 then sending every one of those cars to the crusher, is now pretending it never happened.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Company That Killed the Electric Car Brings It Back
item.itunes:summary: General Motors, after having re-introduced the electric car as the E-V1 then sending every one of those cars to the crusher, is now pretending it never happened.
item.itunes:keywords: Who Killed the Electric Car, environment, global warming, greenhouse, electric cars, hybrid cars, EV1, Chevy Volt
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Bloated Oil Prices Mysteriously Plummet
item.description: The per barrel cost of oil has plummeted 50% from $140 per barrel to under $70 a barrel in less than 4 months; shocking consumers and oil producers alike. In a recent emergency meeting, OPEC ministers admitted that there really is no relation between demand and prices.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bloated Oil Prices Mysteriously Plummet
item.itunes:summary: The per barrel cost of oil has plummeted 50% from $140 per barrel to under $70 a barrel in less than 4 months; shocking consumers and oil producers alike. In a recent emergency meeting, OPEC ministers admitted that there really is no relation between demand and prices.
item.itunes:keywords: environment, global warming, greenhouse, cap and trade, Congress
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Is Global Warming Dead?
item.description: Many Republicans who already thought carbon cap and trade regulation was bad for the economy, now say that with the growing global economic crisis, American energy companies cannot afford to be green.
item.itunes:subtitle: Is Global Warming Dead?
item.itunes:summary: Many Republicans who already thought carbon cap and trade regulation was bad for the economy, now say that with the growing global economic crisis, American energy companies cannot afford to be green.
item.itunes:keywords: environment, global warming, greenhouse, cap and trade, Congress
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Hey, T. Boone, the WindWing is here
item.description: While oilman T. Boone Pickens installs thousands of turbines on his massive wind farm in Texas, a small California company is unveiling an invention that may revolutionize wind power production.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey, T. Boone, the WindWing is here
item.itunes:summary: While oilman T. Boone Pickens installs thousands of turbines on his massive wind farm in Texas, a small California company is unveiling an invention that may revolutionize wind power production.

item.title: Energy Legislation at Last?
item.description: Despite many efforts to pass an energy package, Congress adjourned for summer recess gridlocked and empty-handed. Partisan compromise is essential if we will ever see any real energy legislation.
item.itunes:subtitle: Energy Legislation at Last?
item.itunes:summary: Despite many efforts to pass an energy package, Congress adjourned for summer recess gridlocked and empty-handed. Partisan compromise is essential if we will ever see any real energy legislation.
item.itunes:keywords: renewable energy, clean energy, zero emissions, Congress, energy policy, Obama, McCain, offshore drilling, gas prices
item.itunes:author: The Renewable Minute news team

item.title: Countdown to Energy Reform
item.description: Join us in our weekly call to action as we contact our vacationing Senators every week until they reconvene in September. This week: send a letter to Senators Obama and McCain.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Greening of Google
item.itunes:summary: The Google guys are making good on promises to invest millions of dollars in renewable energy.

item.title: Tax Credit Tango
item.description: The senate last week blocked a vote on the extension of renewable energy tax credits, which expire December 31. If Congress fails to extend the credits, most of theses renewable power projects are in danger of being abandoned.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tax Credit Tango
item.itunes:summary: The senate last week blocked a vote on the extension of renewable energy tax credits, which expire December 31. If Congress fails to extend the credits, most of theses renewable power projects are in danger of being abandoned.
